name: sfchronicle
text: Have we seen the last of traditional media access in sports? https://t.co/XjRjCx7zWK

name: sfchronicle
text: A McDonald’s employee in Oakland said she was grabbed, hit and slapped by a drive-through customer after she told him he had to wear a face mask in order to receive his order. https://t.co/MR9FnQTqe9

name: sfchronicle
text:
For those who make their living covering baseball, a grim new era begins on Friday. 

@Bruce_Jenkins1's column: https://t.co/xLVEUDRXdm

name: sfchronicle
text: Some older Oakland A’s staff members are adjusting their jobs to account for their at-risk status, and team doctor Allen Pont will work remotely during the coronavirus pandemic, he told @susanslusser. https://t.co/ENaazA7o92

name: sfchronicle
text:
The coronavirus isn’t stopping new Bay Area restaurants from opening — even though they can only operate with takeout and delivery.

Here is a running list of what has opened since the Bay Area’s shelter-in-place orders began on March 17.

https://t.co/LRFVTR2mKM

name: sfchronicle
text:
Shut up and dribble? Or work for change? Athletes have power, and no one can stop them from using it, writes @AnnKillion.

https://t.co/L8u13TH7jk

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SportingGreenSF: Sports digest: Sponsor FedEx asks Washington's NFL team to change its nickname; Oakland native Tyson Ross, a free agent recently released by Giants, will join brother Joe in sitting out the MLB season due to coronavirus concerns. https://t.co/VkrUasAOJQ
